```
{
jobs: [array of jobs like before], 
messages: [array of errors/messages/etc] 
} 
```

attachments.text:
*What problem is the feature trying to solve?*

Documentation around fixing rule violations is not specific to website issues. That means a dev has to do lots of work between reading rule documentation, like <https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.2|Deque rules>, and fixing the problem.

*Desired Solution*

LLMs are pretty good at solving code problems if they are tuned to documentation. The solution would be a "Resolve" button next to any issue or page of issues in Equalify. The button would send the specific issues to the LLM, along with a reference to the documentation around whatever rule is being violated. Equalify will then show some suggestions on fixing the issue or issues.

*Alternatives*

We don't need to use LLMs. We could create an old-fashioned library of fixes. But LLMs we are in the AI hype wave, so might as well embrace it?

*Technical Details*

OpenAI gave me $1500 in credits, so anyone tackling this issue can use that.
attachments.title: <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/issues/279|#279 LLM Integration to Suggest Fixes>

attachments.text:
*Summary:*

<https://github.com/heythisischris|@heythisischris> will develop a REST API endpoint which suggests "fixes" to developers looking to complete accessibility action items identified by Equalify. It will served via an AWS Lambda running Node.js. The LLM will either be OpenAI GPT-4 or Anthropic Claude 3 (provided via AWS Bedrock).

*Implementation Plan:*

1. Set up a Node.js Lambda environment, setup CI/CD: <https://github.com/heythisischris|@heythisischris> will create a simple TypeScript Lambda function with a build script that deploys the zip bundle directly to the AWS environment using the AWS CLI. <https://github.com/heythisischris|@heythisischris> will also setup CI/CD using GitHub Actions.
2. Enable Lambda Function URL: This will allow public access to the Lambda and help with testing.
3. Connect OpenAI and/or Anthropic Claude: <https://github.com/heythisischris|@heythisischris> will obtain access to an LLM and integrate to the Lambda function.
4. Study WGAC and begin sketching schema: I will look at commonly identified actions and attempt to create strictly typed actions in JSON format to feed whatever LLM we decide to proceed with. The idea is to emulate a fine-tuned model by feeding a large amount of strictly-typed accessibility context.
5. Define test cases, test API: I will begin testing the newly created LLM API with test cases to make sure accessibility suggestions look decent. I will also begin recording/reporting results and how accurate/helpful the suggestions are.
6. Begin testing with Equalify frontend: I will connect the Equalify frontend with the new LLM API URL and attempt
7. Ask for feedback from the community: I will ask for validation and feedback from the community.

*Rough draft schema*

The endpoint will be "<https://llm.equalify.com|https://llm.equalify.com>". it will only accept POST requests with the following JSON Body data:

```
{
"ActionId": "a0c5fcb1-0996-45ed-b19b-37195d06c21b",
"Time": "2024-03-13T03:00:00.000Z",
"Source": "Little Forest",
"URL": "<https://edupack.dev/sponsors/>",
"Type": "Error",
"Message": "```<title>...</title>```\nCheck that the title element describes the document",
"SuggestionId": null
}
```

The request must be signed with an Auth0 JWT Token set in the header as such:

```
{
"Authorization": "Bearer eyJraWQiOiIxMU1acVRwRlQ2c1pONWtTd0taSGhRVFk3Q1JWVVpQVkJqRG95U3lRVExrPSIsImFsZyI6IlJTMjU2In0.eyJzdWIiOiIyMTNiNzVkMC02MGYxLTcwNDktM2RlNC00NDRmMWY5ZGZjMjYiLCJ3ZWJzaX"
}
```

The response will be a JSON Body with the following format:

```
{
"ActionId": "a0c5fcb1-0996-45ed-b19b-37195d06c21b",
"SuggestionId": "1f5c0c9f-ee33-4bdb-84e5-ea53caa4a5ba",
"Time": "2024-03-13T04:00:00.000Z",
"Title": "You could rename the title attribute to \"EduPack Sponsors\"",
"Code": "<title>EduPack Sponsors</title>",
"Position": [12,48],
"Completed": false
}
```

We can store suggestions in a new MySQL table for future reference.

Obviously, this is a very simple sample response, but I intend on having much more complex answers and functionality as I develop- this is simply a starting point.

*Budget*

The proposed budget for this issue is $3,500. It should take no longer than 1 month to fully develop, deploy, test, and release. This budget was approved by <@U04J7TVCQGP> as part of <https://github.com/EqualifyEverything/equalify/issues/278|#278>.
